jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the role

Polymarket is looking for an experienced Product Designer to join our NYC team. You must live and breathe product and be obsessed with understanding user behavior.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in designing beautiful world-class consumer products, with a high bar for craft and a focus on creating deeply engaging, user-centric experiences. You will work directly with our Founder and company leadership to spearhead every step of the design process from idea to launch, ensuring that our products are not only functional but also delightful.


What you’ll do

  • Visual and interaction design. You’ll create visually stunning and highly interactive designs that resonate with our users. Your work should demonstrate a keen eye for detail and a deep appreciation for craft.

  • Lead design end-to-end. You’ll partner with cross-functional leads and take charge of design initiatives, crafting innovative solutions from scratch that meet both user needs and business goals.

  • Conduct user research. You’ll perform detailed user research to inform design decisions and contribute to the overall strategy and direction of our product.

  • Prototype and test. You’ll create prototypes and conduct usability testing to refine designs based on user feedback.

  • Establish design guidelines. You’ll develop and maintain design guidelines to ensure product consistency across all platforms.


What we’re looking for

  • 8+ years of experience in product design

  • Strong portfolio of design projects, ideally with consumer-facing applications

  • Proficiency in prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD)

  • Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation)

  • Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment

  • An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to bring an idea or vision to life.

  • A passion for the blockchain, decentralized finance, & freedom of speech.

  • (Plus) Experience designing for web and mobile platforms in the fintech or blockchain space

  • Understanding of financial markets, trading, and DeFi is a nice to have. Willingness to learn about them is a must.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

jobs.title: Design Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the role

Polymarket is looking for a design engineer. There are special types of people who love front-end hacking just as much as user-obsessed product design. If that’s you, we want to work together.

The design engineering team is responsible for delivering highly polished, intuitive, and engaging interfaces across all of Polymarket’s products. You’ll partner closely with product designers, engineers, and our founder directly to design and create delightful interactive experiences that make prediction markets more accessible, transparent, and enjoyable for all.


What you’ll do

  • Build and prototype. You’ll code new UI components, animations, and interactions that enhance the overall product experience. You’ll be an advocate for best practices in front-end development and performance optimization.

  • Establish a system. You’ll contribute to Polymarket’s design system, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and performance across all touchpoints.

  • Cross-company collaboration. You’ll work closely with designers and other engineers to define, design, and implement high-quality user experiences.

  • Craft experiences end-to-end. You’ll help lead the technical roadmap for the full product lifecycle—from ideation to implementation and iteration—with a strong sense of ownership.

  • Plan for the future. You’ll keep up with emerging web technologies, design trends, and the evolving blockchain space to continuously elevate Polymarket’s user experience.

What we’re looking for

  • Cracked

  • Obsessed with product

  • 4+ years of professional development experience

  • Proficiency in front-end technologies (React, Next.js, TypeScript) with a focus on interactions, animation, performance, readability, and polish.

  • Deep understanding of design principles (typography, layout, color, illustration). 

  • Experience working with Figma, design tokens, and design systems to bridge the gap between design and development.

  • Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation) with a keen eye for detail

  • A passion for the markets, truth, & freedom of speech.

  • Understanding of DeFi and financial markets is a nice to have. Willingness to learn about them is a must.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

jobs.title: Smart Contract Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the role

Polymarket is looking for an experienced smart contract engineer to join our core protocol team. You’ll design, build, and ship secure, high-performance smart contracts that handle millions in daily volume and keep our peer-to-peer markets running flawlessly.

You’ll have end-to-end ownership—from ideation and architecture to implementation and deployment—while collaborating closely with a world-class engineering team. Expect a mix of building new protocol functionality, improving developer tooling, and responding quickly to the evolving security landscape in DeFi.


What you’ll do

We’re looking for an experienced individual contributor who loves turning tricky protocol problems into clean, secure smart contracts that power billions in on-chain activity.

  • Build secure, battle-tested smart contracts. You’ll design, implement, and deploy Solidity-based contracts that are both elegant and hardened against exploits.

  • Level up the protocol. Contribute to protocol-level infrastructure, tooling, and new features that directly impact millions of users.

  • Respond to real-world challenges. Investigate vulnerabilities, simulate attack scenarios, and develop effective mitigation strategies.

  • Review and refine. Participate in rigorous code reviews to ensure quality, security, and maintainability.

  • Stay ahead of the curve. Keep up with the latest EVM developments, tooling, and best practices—and bring that knowledge back to the team.

  • Mentor and collaborate. Share your expertise with other engineers and work closely across product, design, and operations to bring ideas to life.


What we’re looking for

  • 4+ years of experience writing and deploying Solidity smart contracts in production.

  • Strong understanding of the EVM, DeFi protocols, and decentralized application architecture (including decentralized exchanges – Uniswap V2 + V3, Uniswap X, dYdX v4, etc.).

  • A security-first mindset, with an obsession for catching vulnerabilities before they’re exploited.

  • A track record of delivering high-quality, reliable code in fast-moving environments.

  • A passion for DeFi, Ethereum, and building at the bleeding edge of web3.

  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

  • (Plus) Experience with prediction markets.

  • (Plus) Experience with formal verification tools or advanced Solidity security techniques.

  • (Plus) Contributions to open-source DeFi projects.

  • (Plus) Familiarity with multiple EVM chains and bridging solutions.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

jobs.title: Senior Platform Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the role

Polymarket is looking for a world-class backend engineer to join our platform engineering team as we scale. The ideal candidate is obsessed with performance, security, and scalability—someone who can architect and optimize high-throughput systems with cutting-edge infrastructure. You will play a key role in building and maintaining the foundation that powers our prediction markets, ensuring reliability and efficiency as we continue to grow.


What you’ll do

We're looking for an experienced individual contributor who enjoys working on deeply technical problems and optimizing mission-critical infrastructure.

  • Architect & build backend systems. You'll design, implement, and maintain high-performance backend services and APIs that handle large-scale transactions and real-time data.

  • Optimize performance & scalability. You’ll push the limits of our system’s throughput and efficiency, ensuring seamless operation at scale.

  • Enhance security & reliability. You’ll implement best practices for secure, fault-tolerant, and highly available distributed systems.

  • Cross-company collaboration. You’ll collaborate with front-end engineers, designers, and stakeholders across the company to deliver a fully integrated user experience.

  • Contribute to code reviews. You'll play a critical role in maintaining the high quality of our codebase by providing feedback and suggestions on others' work during code review sessions.

  • Participate in research & innovation. You’ll stay at the forefront of blockchain-based trading technologies, exploring new solutions to improve our platform.

  • Interface with Customers. You’ll communicate directly with customers, providing support and gathering feedback.


What we’re looking for

  • 8+ years of experience in backend development

  • Experience architecting and developing solutions to ambiguous problems with significant impact and high usage

  • Master-level proficiency in systems programming languages like Golang, Rust, or C++

  • Strong knowledge of database systems and internals (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB)

  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP) and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, Ansible)

  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills

  • (Plus) Blockchain-specific backend experience (e.g., working on BFT consensus engines, event indexing systems, libp2p)

  • (Plus) Experience with Ethereum roll-up technologies (e.g., Arbitrum Nova, Optimism)

  • (Plus) Open source contributor

  • (Plus) Active participant on ethresear.ch


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

jobs.title: Senior Product Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.

About the role

Polymarket is looking for a product-obsessed full-stack engineer to join our product engineering team as it grows. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for design, a deep understanding of modern front-end performance optimization, and a desire to impact a growing engineering organization. You will be involved in the entire product lifecycle, from user discussions and concept development to design, implementation, and iteration, with a high level of ownership and minimal bureaucracy.

What you’ll do

We're looking for an experienced individual contributor who enjoys working alongside other experienced engineers and designers to quickly build and iterate on product.

  • Build user-facing features. You'll build out new user-facing features with slick, efficient, and reusable React components.

  • Talk to users. You’ll engage in regular communication with users to understand their needs, gather feedback, and incorporate their insights into product development.

  • Self-direct your work & co-direct the product. You're a technical founder type and will take part in defining and architecting the long-term technical direction of the product engineering team.

  • Cross-company collaboration. You’ll collaborate with engineers, designers, and stakeholders across the company to architect, build, launch, test, and improve features and systems.

  • Improve monitoring & alerting infrastructure & practices. You'll be instrumental in enhancing our monitoring and alerting systems, ensuring that all critical issues are quickly and accurately identified. This will involve both optimizing existing processes and introducing new methodologies and technologies to improve our overall system reliability and responsiveness.

  • Reinforce security, availability, performance, & scalability of the product. You’ll be responsible for ensuring our product meets the highest standards in all these aspects.

  • Contribute to code reviews. You'll play a critical role in maintaining the high quality of our codebase by providing feedback and suggestions on others' work during code review sessions.


What we’re looking for

  • 5+ years of professional software development experience

  • Strong knowledge of Typescript, Javascript (ES6+), CSS (media queries, animations and/or modern animation libraries)

  • Experience working with React & NextJS

  • A deep understanding of modern state management patterns, caching strategies, & libraries (notably React Hooks/Context, React Query, Zustand, Mobx or Recoil)

  • An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to bring an idea or vision to life.

  • A passion for the blockchain, decentralized finance, & freedom of speech.

  • (Plus) Experience working with &/or implementing normalized caching strategies

  • (Plus) Experience working with RSC

  • (Plus) Previous experience working with data-intensive applications

  • (Plus) Previous development experience in the blockchain, crypto, or financial industries (familiarity with wagmi, ethers.js etc)

  • (Plus) Have used Polymarket (or other prediction markets) & understand how they function

  • (Plus) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Internal Tools
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the Role

Polymarket is looking for a pragmatic and resourceful full-stack engineer to join our Platform team. This role is focused on building and maintaining essential internal systems that power the day-to-day operations across the company. Your main focus will be maintaining the essential tools used every day by our team to create and manage the markets that drive Polymarket’s content. You’ll also work on customer service APIs and build quick, effective internal solutions to support a growing and fast-moving organization. This is a great opportunity for someone who loves solving practical problems, building useful tools, and working closely with teammates across different departments.


What You’ll Do

  • Build internal tools that make a difference. Help mission-critical teams (like customer support and operations) work smarter and faster by creating simple, effective tools.

  • Move fast and ship often. You’ll launch small improvements and fixes regularly, without getting bogged down in red tape.

  • Work across the stack. You’ll touch both frontend and backend code, using modern tools and frameworks.

  • Collaborate constantly. You’ll partner with internal users to understand their needs, gather feedback, and make changes quickly.

  • Write clean, reliable code. Help ensure the tools we build are easy to maintain and scale as we grow.

  • Participate in code reviews. Learn from others and help keep our codebase high quality.


What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of professional software development experience

  • Solid experience building full-stack web applications

  • Strong skills in Typescript, Javascript (ES6+), and CSS

  • Experience with React and Node.js (Next.js is a bonus)

  • Great communication and collaboration skills—you enjoy working with others to solve real problems

  • A bias for action—you’re comfortable shipping quickly and iterating based on feedback

  • A builder’s mindset—you enjoy making tools that make life easier for others

  • A passion for the blockchain, decentralized finance, & freedom of speech.

  • (Plus) Experience building internal admin tools or dashboards

  • (Plus) Familiarity with customer service tooling

  • (Plus) Background in fintech, crypto, or data-heavy applications

  • (Plus) Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories

jobs.title: Staff Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s leading prediction market — part financial exchange, part search engine for the future. With over $6B in trading volume this year alone, we’re rapidly becoming a trusted source of truth in an increasingly noisy media landscape.

Our mission is to surface accurate, real-time insight into the world’s most important questions — from politics and tech to sports and science. If we succeed, we’ll redefine how people discover, debate, and understand what’s likely to happen next.

We’re a small, focused team based in NYC, and we’re looking for exceptional people to help shape the future of information.

About the Role

We’re hiring a Staff Product Designer at Polymarket. This is a high-impact, high-autonomy role where you’ll help define the product’s direction and craft the core user experience from first principles.

We’re not a place where roadmaps are handed down or specs are set in stone. We’re looking for someone who thrives in ambiguity — someone who sees undefined spaces as creative opportunities and has the initiative to bring structure, insight, and beauty to complex problems.

You’ll collaborate closely with the Founder and leadership team, owning design end-to-end: from understanding our users and defining product narratives to shipping thoughtful, high-precision interfaces.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead with autonomy. You’ll define and drive design work from scratch — identifying what needs to be done while raising the quality bar, and collaborating closely with engineers and leadership to bring ideas to life.

  • Design for clarity and depth. Our product touches prediction markets, finance, and social networks. Your job is to make these powerful tools feel accessible, intuitive, and engaging.

  • Prototype quickly and test ideas. You’ll use tools like Figma, Cursor, and light code to explore concepts, validate assumptions, and refine interfaces based on real feedback.

  • Develop insights through research. You’ll talk to users, analyze behavior, and extract meaningful patterns that inform product direction.

  • Define and evolve our design system. You’ll create the standards and systems that keep our product cohesive as it grows.

  • Act as a force-multiplier. You’ll raise the bar — not just through your own work, but by modeling great thinking, process, and collaboration across the company.

What We’re Looking For

  • 10+ years of experience designing high-quality consumer products, ideally in early-stage or zero-to-one environments

  • A portfolio that shows you can think at the system level while sweating the details

  • Strong visual and interaction design skills, plus fluency in tools like Figma, Cursor, or V0

  • Clear, thoughtful communication — whether you’re sharing work, making a case, or putting together a presentation

  • A bias towards ownership and action: you know how to figure out what matters, even when the path isn’t obvious

  • Deep curiosity about markets, incentives, and the future of truth

  • Bonus: experience working in fintech, crypto, or data-rich products

  • Bonus: exposure to trading, DeFi, or financial systems — or a hunger to learn quickly

Benefits

  • Office in SoHo, NYC — work alongside a tight-knit, world-class team

  • Daily lunches + micro kitchen

  • Competitive salary + meaningful equity

  • Unlimited PTO + full health, dental, and vision coverage

  • 401(k) match

  • Tools setup (MacBook Pro, monitor, accessories, software/subscription licenses)

Compensation

The cash compensation range for this role is $230,000 – $280,000, depending on experience and level.

Polymarket is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds who share a passion for innovation.

jobs.title: Business Development Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s leading prediction market, where people trade on the world’s most important questions. From elections to sports to culture, we’re building the global source of truth for real-time public sentiment.

Our U.S. platform is growing fast and we’re looking for sharp, creative operators to help bring major partnerships to life.

The Role

We’re hiring a Business Development Analyst to support our highest impact partnerships and strategic initiatives across Polymarket’s business.

You’ll work directly with the partnerships leadership team to source, evaluate, and execute deals, building the financial and strategic frameworks that shape how Polymarket partners with sports leagues, media networks, fintech platforms, and institutions.

This role sits at the intersection of strategy, analytics, and execution. You’ll bring the rigor of investment banking, modeling, diligence, and deal process into an environment where speed, creativity, and judgment matter just as much.

What You’ll Do

  • Support evaluation and execution of key partnerships, integrations, and commercial deals.

  • Build detailed financial models, forecasts, and ROI analyses for new opportunities.

  • Conduct market mapping and competitive benchmarking across fintech, sports, and media.

  • Support negotiation strategy by modeling deal terms, incentives, and long-term impact on trading volume and revenue.

  • Manage internal deal trackers, diligence pipelines, and performance dashboards.

  • Draft and refine materials for partner pitches and internal investment memos.

  • Collaborate with legal, product, tech and marketing to operationalize approved deals.

  • Surface insights and trends from data to guide BD strategy and prioritization.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2–5 years of experience in investment banking, private equity, management consulting, or corporate development. Banking is ideal.

  • Proven analytical and financial modeling skills with strong attention to detail.

  • Experience translating financial or market data into actionable business insights.

  • Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; familiarity with SQL or BI tools is a plus.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication, able to turn analysis into clear narratives.

  • Strong understanding of deal structures, valuation, and partnership economics.

  • High agency operator who thrives in fast paced, ambiguous environments.

  • A genuine interest in crypto, fintech, or markets; curiosity about the Polymarket mission.

Why This Is Cool

Help shape the US growth story for one of the most disruptive platforms in media and markets.

Work directly with Polymarket’s leadership on high stakes partnerships and deals.

Bring major leagues, media outlets, and cultural brands to life through data, creativity, and speed.

How to Apply

Stand out from the crowd! Include a short blurb describing a partnership or deal you’ve worked on and how you helped bring it to life. Feel free to redact any sensitive information.

jobs.title: Market Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Market Analyst
Location: New York (remote possible)
Type: Full-time (contract-to-hire possible)
Compensation: Competitive salary + performance incentives

About Polymarket
Polymarket is the world’s leading prediction markets platform — where people trade on the world’s most important questions. From elections to crypto to sports and pop culture, we’re building the global source of truth for real-time public opinion. We help people grasp the future by letting them trade on real-world events — and our edge comes from airtight market rules, trusted resolutions, and being first to what matters.

The Role
We’re hiring a Market Analyst to shape, curate, and safeguard the backbone of Polymarket’s markets. You’ll decide what to launch and when, craft precise and innovative rulesets, and ensure our markets are always clear, fair, and dispute-proof. You’ll work across research, market ops, and product to keep our coverage timely, relevant, and high-quality — from spotting the next big thing online to drafting bulletproof rules that keep traders confident.

What You’ll Do

  • Own coverage: Ensure we’re covering the right topics at the right time across politics, crypto, sports, current events, and culture.

  • Invent rulesets: Draft precise, innovative criteria for new market types and edge-case scenarios.

  • Prioritize new markets: Decide what to launch and when to maximize relevance and engagement.

  • Curate & clarify: Continuously tighten wording on live markets and publish clarifications.

  • Audit resolutions: Review resolved markets for consistency, source integrity, and adherence to rule spirit.

  • Build pipelines: Turn raw events into recurring, scalable market categories.

  • Monitor the internet: Track trends, bubbling stories, and key events to ensure Polymarket stays first to what matters.

  • Build playbooks: Systematize best practices for rule drafting and dispute handling.

  • Monitor industry standards: Track regulatory guidance and peer platforms to keep Polymarket ahead of compliance risk.

  • Experiment: Pilot new formats and market types to push the frontier.

What We’re Looking For

  • Sharp legal/analytical mind: You spot loopholes before they’re problems and love airtight wording.

  • Strong editorial taste: You know what matters and what’s noise.

  • Exceptional technical writing: Clear, neutral, and unambiguous prose—no wiggle room.

  • Market intuition: Understanding of how incentives, liquidity, and trader behavior interact with rules.

  • High agency: You proactively hunt for issues and ship fixes fast.

  • Data & process rigor: Comfortable mining data, building checklists, and scaling audits with light automation.

  • Fast decision-making: You thrive in a fast-moving environment.

  • Forecasting fluency: Bonus if you’re familiar with crypto, sports, or political markets.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in prediction markets, sports-book operations, compliance, or exchange rulebooks.

  • Background in law, risk, journalism, or dispute resolution.

  • Product instinct: You think in systems and user flows, not just content.

  • Ability to script or automate QA tools (SQL, Python, etc.).

  • Networked in key verticals (sports, politics, crypto, etc.).

  • Personal trading or market-making history on Polymarket or similar platforms.

  • Prior startup or high-agency team experience.

Why This Is Cool

  • Own the truth layer: Your work decides how the world’s biggest prediction markets resolve.

  • Green-field impact: Set the gold standard for market integrity and topical coverage in a frontier industry.

  • Shape the core product of the most culturally relevant prediction market in the world.

  • Fast lane: Ship, learn, and iterate at the pace of a generational startup poised for massive growth.

How to Apply
Send us:

  • Three markets you’d launch today (include rules and reasoning for why).

  • A recent trend we should have covered but didn’t.

  • Any relevant writing samples, legal analysis, or tooling you’ve built.

  • Any links (Twitter, Substack, GitHub, Notion, etc.) that showcase your thinking or work.

jobs.title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the role

Polymarket is looking for a world-class infrastructure engineer to join our team and help scale the systems that power our products. You’ll be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the backbone of our engineering platform—from developer workflows and CI/CD pipelines to core infrastructure that supports high-performance APIs and data services. You’ll have the autonomy to make big technical decisions, drive system architecture, and implement solutions that balance speed, reliability, and long-term maintainability.


What you’ll do

We're looking for an experienced individual contributor who enjoys optimizing mission-critical infrastructure.

  • Build & automate development workflows. You’ll design and maintain infrastructure that standardizes how we develop, version, test, and deploy software across environments.

  • Architect scalable systems. You’ll make thoughtful architectural decisions and tradeoffs, balancing risk, performance, cost, and maintainability.

  • Power high-performance services. You’ll contribute to infrastructure supporting real-time APIs and low-latency data feeds.

  • Develop testing infrastructure. You’ll build robust tooling for automated testing at all levels—from unit to integration to API.

  • Ensure availability & reliability. You’ll own critical infrastructure that minimizes downtime and reduces risk of failure.

  • Move fast without breaking things. You’ll deliver high-quality solutions quickly, with a strong sense of ownership and attention to detail.

  • Operate autonomously. You’ll take initiative and make independent decisions—no micromanagement here.

  • Collaborate across teams. You’ll work closely with engineers throughout the company to support deployment, performance, and operational needs.


What we’re looking for

  • 6+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering, with a strong track record of delivering production-grade systems.

  • Deep familiarity with cloud infrastructure and DevOps tooling, including AWS, Kubernetes (K8s), Terraform, Kafka, load balancing, ElasticCache, messaging queues, Flux, Docker, GitHub Workflows, Cloudflare, FluxCD, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, S3, Lambda, and AWS networking (VPCs, VPC Peering).

  • Excellent communication skills and a strong desire to learn, grow, and collaborate effectively across teams.

  • Solid technical acumen and a results-driven mindset, capable of solving complex engineering challenges with practical solutions.

  • Proven history of improving engineering workflows, through the creation and implementation of new tools and processes that boost efficiency and consistency.

  • Leadership experience in planning and executing large-scale projects, with lasting impact on core systems or engineering teams.

  • Ability to ship quickly and iterate fast, without compromising quality.

  • Exceptional judgment in prioritizing tasks, balancing urgency with strategic importance.

  • Growth-oriented mindset, with a steep learning curve and an eagerness to evolve with the role.

  • Genuine passion for engineering—you take pride in your craft and strive for excellence in everything you build.

  • Specialized expertise in at least one of the following areas:

    • Networking: demonstrated ability to diagnose and resolve complex network-related issues.

    • Security: Relevant certifications, such as CISSP, CISM, or AWS certifications, or equivalent experience in designing secure systems.

  • (PLUS) Proven experience building deployment systems in:

    • K8S

    • RDS / PSQL

    • IAM policies/roles

    • ElasticCache

    • Cloud Networking (VPC peering, subnets, etc)


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

jobs.title: Developer Relations Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Developer Relations Manager

About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. Polymarket enables users to trade on the outcomes of various real-world events, including politics, finance, and entertainment. By leveraging blockchain technology, the platform offers a decentralized and transparent marketplace for predictions, allowing individuals to monetize their insights and forecasts.

Role & Responsibilities

Polymarket is looking for a Developer Relations Manager who thrives at the intersection of technology, community, and business development. You'll be the bridge connecting our vibrant ecosystem of traders, builders, and partners with our core product team — driving growth through authentic relationships and technical excellence.

What You'll Own

  • Community Leadership: Cultivate and champion our global network of developers, traders, and market creators. Turn community feedback into actionable product insights and ensure our builders feel supported and heard.

  • Technical Partnership Strategy: Guide external teams through integrations with Polymarket's APIs. You'll be the technical point person ensuring partners ship successful integrations while identifying opportunities to improve our developer experience.

  • Strategic Alliance Building: Source and nurture partnerships with crypto protocols, research institutions, media partners, and complementary platforms that expand Polymarket's reach and utility.

  • Ecosystem Development: Build deeper relationships with market creators, liquidity providers, and institutional participants who drive trading volume and market quality.

  • Grants Program Leadership: Run our ecosystem grants program end-to-end — from sourcing promising applications to shepherding funded projects through successful launches.

  • Internal Advocacy: Serve as the voice of our external community within Polymarket, working cross-functionally to ensure partner and developer needs shape our product roadmap.

Experience & Skills

  • 3–5+ years in developer relations, business development, or ecosystem growth within crypto, DeFi, or emerging tech environments

  • Deep web3 fluency — you understand blockchain mechanics, smart contracts, and decentralized systems beyond surface level

  • API-first mindset — comfortable working with REST/GraphQL APIs, troubleshooting integrations, and guiding partners through technical implementations

  • Hands-on technical skills in Python or TypeScript for testing, debugging, and building proof-of-concepts

  • Exceptional communication — can translate complex technical concepts for diverse audiences, from developers to executives

  • Polymarket familiarity — knowledge of our existing APIs and platform, or demonstrated ability to rapidly learn new technical systems

  • Bonus points: Background in prediction markets, trading platforms, or quantitative finance

🎁 What We Offer

  • Innovative Environment: Be at the cutting edge of crypto, forecasting, and decentralized markets.

  • High-Impact Role: Your work will directly influence the growth and success of Polymarket’s ecosystem.

  • Career Growth: Expand your skills and network in a rapidly evolving industry.
    Competitive Compensation: Salary plus equity package.

  • Benefits:

    • Unlimited PTO

    • Medical, Dental & Vision Coverage

    • $15/day Lunch Credit

jobs.descriptionPlain:
DEVELOPER RELATIONS MANAGER


ABOUT POLYMARKET

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. Polymarket enables users to trade on the outcomes of various real-world events, including politics, finance, and entertainment. By leveraging blockchain technology, the platform offers a decentralized and transparent marketplace for predictions, allowing individuals to monetize their insights and forecasts.


ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

Polymarket is looking for a Developer Relations Manager who thrives at the intersection of technology, community, and business development. You'll be the bridge connecting our vibrant ecosystem of traders, builders, and partners with our core product team — driving growth through authentic relationships and technical excellence.

What You'll Own

 - Community Leadership: Cultivate and champion our global network of developers, traders, and market creators. Turn community feedback into actionable product insights and ensure our builders feel supported and heard.

 - Technical Partnership Strategy: Guide external teams through integrations with Polymarket's APIs. You'll be the technical point person ensuring partners ship successful integrations while identifying opportunities to improve our developer experience.

 - Strategic Alliance Building: Source and nurture partnerships with crypto protocols, research institutions, media partners, and complementary platforms that expand Polymarket's reach and utility.

 - Ecosystem Development: Build deeper relationships with market creators, liquidity providers, and institutional participants who drive trading volume and market quality.

 - Grants Program Leadership: Run our ecosystem grants program end-to-end — from sourcing promising applications to shepherding funded projects through successful launches.

 - Internal Advocacy: Serve as the voice of our external community within Polymarket, working cross-functionally to ensure partner and developer needs shape our product roadmap.


EXPERIENCE & SKILLS

 - 3–5+ years in developer relations, business development, or ecosystem growth within crypto, DeFi, or emerging tech environments

 - Deep web3 fluency — you understand blockchain mechanics, smart contracts, and decentralized systems beyond surface level

 - API-first mindset — comfortable working with REST/GraphQL APIs, troubleshooting integrations, and guiding partners through technical implementations

 - Hands-on technical skills in Python or TypeScript for testing, debugging, and building proof-of-concepts

 - Exceptional communication — can translate complex technical concepts for diverse audiences, from developers to executives

 - Polymarket familiarity — knowledge of our existing APIs and platform, or demonstrated ability to rapidly learn new technical systems

 - Bonus points: Background in prediction markets, trading platforms, or quantitative finance


🎁 WHAT WE OFFER

 - Innovative Environment: Be at the cutting edge of crypto, forecasting, and decentralized markets.

 - High-Impact Role: Your work will directly influence the growth and success of Polymarket’s ecosystem.

 - Career Growth: Expand your skills and network in a rapidly evolving industry.
   Competitive Compensation: Salary plus equity package.

 - Benefits:
   
   - Unlimited PTO
   
   - Medical, Dental & Vision Coverage
   
   - $15/day Lunch Credit
   
   - $315/month Gym Credit
   
   - 401K with match

jobs.title: Partner Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s leading prediction market, where people trade on the world’s most important questions. From elections to sports to culture, we’re building the global source of truth for real-time public sentiment.

Our U.S. platform is growing fast and we’re looking for sharp, creative operators to help bring major partnerships to life.

The Role

We’re hiring a Partner Manager to own post-close execution for strategic partnerships across sports, media, and entertainment.

You’ll take important deals from contract to impact, launching campaigns, events, and data integrations that drive measurable growth. You’ll manage partner relationships and turn ideas into user growth, engagement, and brand visibility.

We can’t drop the ball with our partners! You’ll think like a marketer, operate like a project manager, and negotiate like a business developer, all while ensuring every partner sees Polymarket as the best collaborator.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead post-close execution for Polymarket partnerships from kickoff through launch and ongoing growth.

  • Build activation plans and coordinate cross-functional teams across marketing, product, and design.

  • Develop creative campaigns, content, and events that drive engagement and measurable results.

  • Manage ongoing partner relationships, performance tracking, and reporting.

  • Identify and execute opportunities to expand and optimize partnerships.

  • Ensure every activation delivers measurable ROI and strategic impact.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years in partnerships, marketing, account management, or brand activations.

  • Proven experience managing post-sale or sponsorship activations end-to-end.

  • Strong commercial instincts — understands ROI and how to grow partner value.

  • Highly organized with strong project management and communication skills.

  • Creative and analytical thinker who thrives in fast-moving environments.

  • Bonus: experience in sports, media, fintech, or events.

Why This Is Cool

  • Shape the US growth story for one of the most disruptive platforms in media and markets.

  • Bring partnerships to life with data, creativity, and speed.

  • Work directly with major leagues, media outlets, and cultural brands.

How to Apply

  • Stand out from the crowd! Include a short blurb describing a partnership, activation, or campaign you helped bring to life and what made it successful. Feel free to add any project trackers, decks, or outputs that show what you made happen.

jobs.title: U.S. Customer Support
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Polymarket

Polymarket is the world’s largest prediction market. It’s half "put your money where your mouth is," half search engine for the future.

We're growing fast – both in terms of volume (>$6B traded so far this year) and adoption as an alternative news source. Our ambition is to become a ubiquitous beacon of truth in global media and we need your help adding fuel to the fire.


About the Role

We’re looking for a community-first customer support lead to own the user experience across live chat, email, and beyond. You’ll be the trusted voice of Polymarket for thousands of users, solving problems in real time, spotting trends before they become issues, and helping shape the way we engage with our community.

This role goes beyond answering questions—you’ll build processes, create tools, and train others to deliver the kind of support that keeps users coming back. If you’re the kind of person who thrives in fast-moving environments, loves free markets, enjoys crypto culture, you’ll fit right in.


What you'll do

  • Manage customer support inquiries, discord messages and live chat during multiple timezones.

  • Collaborate with regulated entities to maintain clear, compliant, and regulator-ready communication across all touchpoints.

  • Develop and lead a culture of delightful customer support across multiple channels (discord, email, telegram & chat).

  • Act as a trusted point of contact for the community and escalate high priority issues related to product, design & engineering teams.

  • Build internal programs, tools, resources and training to help launch or improve product support workflows.

  • Ensure compliance with Polymarket regulations and standards.

  • Use data and customer paint points to identify opportunities to reduce customer friction.

What we're looking for

  • The perfect candidate has operated at the intersection of finance, technology, and user engagement, and brings familiarity with fast-moving ecosystems at innovative trading, crypto, or gaming platforms.

  • We’re looking for someone with 4+ years of experience in financial services, fintech, gaming, or web3 — ideally with hands-on exposure to exchanges, digital asset platforms, or regulated fintech environments.

  • Experience in payments, market operations, KYC/AML compliance, or trading infrastructure is highly valued, as is a comfort navigating the evolving world of financial technology, crypto, and decentralized finance (DeFi).

  • Familiarity with managing large Discord or online communities is preferred, along with an understanding of current best practices for community engagement and moderation.

  • Polymarket is a 24/7/365 business so availability to work shifts on weekends, and outside of the "standard" work day.

  • You can pivot on the fly. Polymarket is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.

  • You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone.

  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences.

  • You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, Prediction Markets, DAOs, and Web 3.0.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & equity

  • Unlimited PTO, Health, Vision, & Dental coverage

  • 401k match

  • Hardware setup — new MacBook Pro, big display, & accessories.

  • In Office Lunch Provided 5 days per week

  • Wealth of Complimentary Snack and Drink Options in office.
